conclusion: To find the propagation speed of light in water using the vertex angle of the cone shaft section and the speed of light in vacuum.
Identify the formula to calculate the speed of light in a medium: v = sqrt(g/rho).
Calculate gravitational acceleration using g = GM/r^2 with Earth's mass and radius.
Density of water is approximately 1000 kg/mÂ³.
Substitute values into the speed of light formula: v = sqrt(g/rho) to find v.
The propagation speed of light in water is approximately 3.98 x 10^-10 m/s.
